IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: SERVICES TO PERSONS WHO HAVE COMPLEX SOCIAL, HEALTH OR OTHER RELATED OR FAMILY PROBLEMS WHICH HAVE INTERFERED WITH THEIR ABTILITY TO LEAD A HEALTHY OR CONSTRUCTIVE LIFE OR WHO ARE AN ENDANGERMENT TO THEMSELVES, THEIR FAMILY OR THE COMMUNITY IN WHICH THEY LIVE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TASC works with families, organizations, and public systems to build healthy and safe communities. We provide services to help individuals overcome addictive and other behavioral illnesses and their consequences. We advocate for policies and services that help individuals reclaim control of their lives. We respect the dignity, value, and potential of all people.
IRS990.Description: ASSESSMENTS, TREATMENT REFERRAL AND MONITORING OF ALCOHOL AND DRUG DEPENDENT INDIVIDUALS.

NameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: TASC INC BUSINESS OFFICE - ROY FESMIRE

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: TASC, Inc. employee George A.H. Williams is a registered Illinois lobbyist but did not expend any funds for lobbying in 2009. $17,850 was expended to consultants for Illinois lobbying.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: TASC is a tax-exempt organization as defined by Section 501(c)(3) of the IRC. However, income from certain activities not directly related to TASC's tax-exempt purpose is subject to taxation as unrelated business income. There were no taxes owed for the years ended June 30, 2010 and 2009. TASC files tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction and one state. The federal and state tax returns of TASC for 2006, 2007, and 2008 are subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service and state taxing authorities, generally for three years after they were filed. Effective July 1, 2009, TASC adopted FASB Accounting Standards Codification No. 740-10, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes, (ASC 740-10), which clarifies the accounting for income taxes by prescribing a minimum recognition threshold a tax position is required to meet before being recognized in the financial statements. TASC was not required to record a liability for unrecognized tax benefits as a result of implementing the new requirements.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Rent, utilities and occupandy costs through various TASC programs.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 is reviewed by the Audit Committee Chair, CFO and other Business Office staff before it is filed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization monitors and enforces compliance of its conflict of interest policy through the annual distribution and completion of statements by the staff as well as the Board of Directors. If a potential conflict is identified for a staff member then a determination is made by senior management as to the action taken regarding the potential conflict as consistent with the policy. If a potential conflict is identified for a member of the Board of Directors then a determination is made by the other members of the Board regarding the action taken. Generally, all potential conflicts are handled on a case by case basis with the following potential resolutions (1) allow situation to continue and/or require that the situation be discontinued through either removal of the activity or removal of the individual (2) prohibition of the individual from all matters related to the potential conflict.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The CEO compensation is reviewed and determined annually by the organization's Board of Directors. The review generally includes the gathering of compensation data of other CEO's of comparable organizations. The review may also include the use of publicly available CEO compensation data through industry sources and surveys and published labor statistics. Information is reviewed and discussed along with CEO performance prior to a determination of compensation. Other top management officials compensation is determined by the CEO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization provides this information upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Audit committee was formed during the year.
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Organization formed an audit committee during the year. It is in the process of formalizing its charter/responsibilities which will include oversight of the audit and selection of an independent accountant. The current year audited financial statement were reviewed by the audit committee chair.
